result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron M Erdmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to 2014CF8 and 2014CF9.  Court grants the defendant 11 days of sentence credit if probation becomes revoked.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to obtain a Mental Health Assessment and comply with any follow-up
-Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Court orders the court costs be reduced to a civil judgment.
To commence immediately.  No huber for the first 3 months.  If huber is granted, Court will allow out of county service and out of county travel.

-Court grants defendant 118 days of sentence credit.

State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report with no corrections, additions or deletions.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing argument by ADA. 2014CF8 (Ct 1 & Ct 2) - SWD and places the defendant on probation for 3 years - (Ct 2 is concurrent to count 1).

CONDITIONS: 

(CT 1 only) 9 months county jail, with huber - concurrent to any other sentence the defendant is serving.
(Ct 1 only) Restitution $735.00
-Court costs
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

2014CF9 (Ct 1) - SWD and places the defendant on probation for 2 years - concurrent to 2014CF8.

2014CF10 (Ct 1) - SWD and places the defendant on probation for 3 years - concurrent to 2014CF9.

CONDITIONS (EACH case):

-Court costs
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to obtain a Mental Health Assessment and comply with any follow-up
-Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-14 hours of community service

Court grants the defendant 11 days of sentence credit on 2010CF10 if probation becomes revoked.
Court finds if the defendant becomes revoked, he will be eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

Court orders any cash bonds on file in the cases are to be applied to the court costs.

Court allows any in-patient treatment  be credited against the jail sentence.

10:21 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Jeffrey Haase.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Haase recites agreement - 2014CF8 defendant will plea to counts 1 & 2. 2014CF9 - defendant will plea to count 1. 2014CF10 - defendant will plea to count 1.  2014CM27 and 2014CF86 are to be dismissed and read-in and parties request a PSI.  ADA concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to counts 1 & 2 on 2014CF8, count 1 on 2014CF9 & count 1 on 2014CF10.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 on 2014CF10, count 1 on 2014.  Court orders the balance of the counts and 2014CM27 & 2014CF86 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a pre-sentence investigation be conducted and filed with the court within 60 days and sentencing is to be scheduled thereafter.  

Statement by ADA - has received correspondence from the victims requesting bond be modified on 2014CF8 to allow contact with the victims.  Court amends the bond to allow contact.  All other conditions remain the same.

Statement by Atty Haase - defendant's mother is here and would like to say something.  Statement by Carla in regards to the bond - requests it be returned back to her.  No objection by ADA on 14CF10 to convert to a signature bond.  No obection by Atty Haase.  Court amends bond on 14CF10 to a $500 signature bond and the cash bond be returned to the poster.

Court adjourned at 10:33 a.m.
Fond du lac County Jail - 11/11/2014 at 9:30 a.m. (Plea Hearing)
from Atty Haase dated October 23, 2014 - defendant is still incarcerated in the FDL County Jail, a writ will be needed for the plea hearing scheduled on 11/04.

1:14 p.m.  Defendant in custody and in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  Kyle Sargent for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause.
